alert.note: Alert for Carroll; City of Galax; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 12:54PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory In Effect for Eastern Grayson, Western Carroll, and the City of Galax... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Carroll, City of Galax, and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1251 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Galax. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen just during the past hour. The ground is saturated in this area from previous heavy rainfall. Additional rainfall will quickly result in excessive runoff and flooding. - The City of Galax is the most likely location within the Flood Advisory to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek, Dixon Branch, Hanks Branch, Little Cranberry Creek, Little River, Chestnut Creek, Crooked Creek, Meadow Creek, East Fork Crooked Creek, Fisher River, Beaver Creek and Glady Fork. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rainfall will significantly increase the flood threat. Flooding is imminent. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Galax... Fries... Pipers Gap... Baywood... Woodlawn... - For additional information on creeks, streams, rivers, and lake levels in our forecast area please go to our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary/Preparedness Statements: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
